intro: Senecio trilobus, commonly known as the three-lobed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Its leaves are deeply lobed, and the flowers are yellow with a central disc, typical of the daisy family. Senecio trilobus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and hardy nature.
